Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2009 09:34PM bettyelay wrote: Thanks for all the answers.  I have applied for charity care at the hospital.  They are still processing it and I'm fighting with them on some of the ways they count income.  I got an official denial letter from the state for the Breast Cancer Medicaid.  So I can start fighting on that.  It won't help me, but maybe I can help the next woman that is in my situation.  The hospital has been very accomodating with my treatments.  No more hassle, but I've also become that squeaky wheel.
Posts.Title: Lack of insurance bettyelay bettyelay

Posts.Content: bettyelay wrote: I was just diagnosed on 9/2.  Still waiting on staging, HER2 receptors.  Start Chemo on Thursday.  But, I am on of America's uninsured.  I own my own company and cannot afford $500.00 a month. My oncologist wanted a PET scan to check METS before we start Chemo and the hospital has refused to do it.  I have talked to EVERYONE in the Medicaid program at the county and state level.  There are programs, but you have to had jumped thru their hoops before your diagnosis.  Craziest thing I've ever seen.  Anybody else can offer any suggestions.  They say they will still give me my chemo.  But what about my surgery, then more chemo, and radiation????  I am sooooo frustrated.
